title: 115_s2012
content: The "Tribal Economic Assistance Act of 2017" repeals the Essential Governmental Function Requirement for Indian tribes regarding bond issuance. It also makes permanent the Indian Employment Credit and depreciation rules for business property on Indian reservations. The Indian Employment Credit and accelerated depreciation rules for business property on Indian reservations were amended to apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2016. Additionally, there is a priority under the New Markets Tax Credit for qualified low-income community investments on Indian reservations. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 was amended to include provisions for qualified low-income community investments within reservations, including those made by tribes or economic enterprises. Definitions for terms like 'reservation', 'tribe', and 'economic' were also provided. The amendments made by this section apply to calendar years beginning after December 31, 2017. SEC. 5. Authorization to establish qualified Indian school construction bond escrow account under the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to establish a Federal escrow account for qualified Indian school construction bonds under the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. The Secretary will use the Federal escrow account to approve and support qualified school construction bonds for Bureau of Indian Affairs-funded schools. Upon approval, funds will be deposited into individual bond escrow accounts for managing the construction bonds. The construction bond funds will be held in an individual bond escrow account, managed by the Federal Government or an insured depository institution. The amount in the account must be enough to repay the bond in 15 years. The Secretary will transfer sums to the Federal escrow account for implementing the section. The Secretary can accept funds from various sources for implementing the section, including Federal agencies, public agencies, Indian Tribes, nonprofit organizations, and private sector entities. Amendments are made to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act and the Internal Revenue Code regarding the use of bonds for preconstruction costs.
